channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What can Northvolt’s failure teach us about Europe’s competitive future?
item.description: How a company founded by two former Tesla executives managed to fail despite such a massive amount of capital will be a case study for business school...

item.title: “Decarbonization is not just a climate plan, it is an economic strategy.” Why European competitiveness hinges on homegrown power
item.description: Can political commitment, leadership capability, and business involvement power Europe's future and boost its global competitiveness? In the remaining...

item.title: Trumps Claims Discrimination by Banks Ahead of ‘Debanking’ Crackdown
item.description: JPMorgan and Bank of America rejected Trump Organization deposits, the president said, fueling his displeasure with Wall Street.

item.title: Patagonia CEO: The EPA is ‘endangering’ America’s businesses on climate
item.description: Instead of delivering on environmental protection, the head of the EPA is talking about gas prices.

item.title: The Redistricting Clash in Texas, Explained
item.description: We take a look at the political fight over a redrawn map.

item.title: The America We Knew Is Rapidly Slipping Away
item.description: When Trump fired the top labor statistics official, the aides responsible for running our economy went along for the ride.

item.title: Figma’s CEO is now worth $5 billion after IPO—like Mark Zuckerberg, he dropped out of college to build a tech empire instead of sitting in class
item.description: As Gen Z questions the value of higher education, Figma CEO Dylan Field is the latest tech billionaire to make it big without a college degree.

item.title: China’s Fight Against Chikungunya Virus Tests a City’s Post-Covid Patience
item.description: The authorities are inspecting homes, tracking purchases of fever medicines and deploying drones as they urge people to join an eradication campaign t...

item.title: As Europe pushes towards its €1.5 trillion renewables target, companies like Ikea look for green power opportunities today
item.description: Companies like Ikea and Stegra illustrate how European businesses are increasingly viewing the transition as an opportunity in itself, rather than sim...

item.title: 16 Handles’ CEO and YouTuber Danny Duncan are Trying to Save Frozen Yogurt
item.description: The frozen treat was inescapable a decade ago, then seemed to vanish. But one C.E.O., with help from the YouTuber Danny Duncan, is firing up the fro-y...

item.title: Tommy Robinson, Far-Right UK Activist, Is Arrested Over Train Station Assault
item.description: Tommy Robinson was taken into custody for questioning on Monday after an assault that seriously injured a man last month at St. Pancras train station.

item.title: Rwanda Agrees to Accept 250 Migrants as Part of Trump Deportation Plan
item.description: The country is the latest African nation to agree to take in migrants from the United States.

item.title: Search Underway for Alec Luhn, American Journalist Missing in Norway
item.description: A search was underway Tuesday for Alec Luhn, 38, who was last heard from five days ago at the start of a solo hike.

item.title: China’s Fight Against Chikungunya Virus Tests a City’s Post-Covid Patience
item.description: The authorities are inspecting homes, tracking purchases of fever medicines and deploying drones as they urge people to join an eradication campaign t...

item.title: Stella Rimington, First Woman to Lead British Intelligence Agency, Dies at 90
item.description: Widely regarded as the inspiration for the recast of the James Bond character “M,” she was the first British spy chief to be publicly named and photog...
